title: Brisbane double-fatal crash driver charged
text:
Emergency services cleaning up the aftermath of a crash involving a stolen car in Bald Hills where two people were killed.

A man who allegedly fatally hit a Brisbane father in a stolen car and left his passengers dead and injured has been charged.

The head-on collision killed Shahid Islam and another man.

Mr Islam, 36, was killed instantly when a stolen four-wheel drive crossed onto the wrong side of the road and ploughed into his vehicle at Bald Hills about midnight on Tuesday.

A 32-year-old man, John William Weatherall, in the stolen car was also killed, while a 32-year-old female passenger is in a critical condition.

The 28-year-old male driver, Jordan Cubby, reportedly spat at police and tried to flee the scene before being sedated and taken to hospital in a serious condition.

Now he has been charged at a hospital bedside hearing with evasion, unlawful use of a motor vehicle, serious assault of a police officer and dangerous operation of a vehicle causing grievous bodily harm or death while excessively speeding, a police spokesman confirmed.

Police said the Mitsubishi 4WD had been stolen from Toowoomba on Monday. Officers tried to intercept it just before midnight on Tuesday but the driver sped away, with officers electing not to pursue.

A short time later the vehicle smashed into Mr Islam’s hatchback.

Cubby sustained moderate injuries as well as fractures, allegedly kicking his way free of the wreckage and attempting to flee the scene.

The Courier Mail reports he was ­sedated by paramedics at the scene of the crash after allegedly spitting blood at police officers.

He was taken to hospital under police guard and is expected to appear in court today from his hospital bed.

Meanwhile, tributes have been posted online for Mr Islam.

“Friends and family please pray for the departed soul,” close friend Tabassum Salam said in a Facebook post on Wednesday.

“May Allah give enough patience to the family to bear this loss.

“Don’t know what to say and how to say this to his four-year-old son.”

Others commented that his death was “heartbreaking”, “extremely sad” and “horrific news”.

“May Allah gives strength to his family to overcome this unbearable sorrows,” Shakila Yusuf Runa said.

Mr Islam also reportedly played cricket for the Northern Stars recreational cricket team.

In a Facebook post, the Bengal Warriors Cricket Club said its “heartfelt condolences” were with his family and teammates.

The Forensic Crash Unit is investigating and has appealed for witnesses or anyone with footage to come forward.
description: A man who allegedly fatally hit a Brisbane father in a stolen car and left his passengers dead and injured has been charged.
